items.title: 'The Game Is Rigged' Says Kevin O'Leary On Credit Card Points. He Claims They're Inflating Faster Than The Dollar And Always Cashes Out Fast
items.description: Kevin O'Leary, the entrepreneur and investor known as Mr. Wonderful from “Shark Tank,” recently shared his thoughts on loyalty programs, describing them as a losing game for consumers. “Loyalty programs? Don't fall for the hype. Points are inflating faster than the dollar,” O’Leary wrote on X recently. Why O'Leary Cashes Out Quickly In the same post, he shared a video in which he elaborated further. "Loyalty schemes and point systems. Worthless, worthless," he said. "The inflation in points from

items.title: The Best Stocks to Invest $1,000 in Right Now
items.description: Major benchmarks are down this year amid concerns about import tariffs and their impact on economic growth.  The stock market may not seem like the friendliest place for investors right now, with the three major benchmarks -- the S&P 500, the Dow Jones Industrial Average, and the Nasdaq Composite -- down since the start of the year.  Worries about President Donald Trump's plan to impose tariffs on imports have halted the positive momentum that carried indexes over the past two years.
